abstract: Health maintenance organizations are returning to prominence, moving past their reputation as symbol of all that is wrong with health insurance; insurers are eager to bring back features that restrict choices of doctors or hospitals as way to cut costs.
lead_paragraph: The plans are making a comeback, but they are so tainted by their poor reputation that insurers and companies try to avoid calling them H.M.O.s.

headline.main: Trying to Revive H.M.O.s, but Without Those Scarlet Letters
headline.print_headline: H.M.O.s Make a Comeback,  Despite Stigma

snippet: The plans are making a comeback, but they are so tainted by their poor reputation that insurers and companies try to avoid calling them H.M.O.s.

keywords.value: Blue Cross and Blue Shield Assn
keywords.name: organizations
